page.title: 02Land Use at Two Bridges
page.content:
{Dartmoor National Park {} Two Bridges is located centrally in the Dartmoor National Park and although the land has to support the local community, it is also in great demand for recreational use, a de facto right of access extending across the whole of the high moor.
The are is mainly used for hiking, rambling and camping; also to a lesser extent for the study of natural history and both archeology and industrial archeology.
The soil is too poor to support arable farming, the land being of great importance for the summer grazing of sheep, cattle and ponies.
